elements.title: French law of 29 December 1915 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the French law of 29 December 1915 established the right for French soldiers to be buried in individual graves (examples pictured)?

elements.title: Philippine consulate general in Chicago (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Chicago Police Department regularly cited vehicles of the Philippine consulate general in Chicago for parking in a no-parking zone, causing a diplomatic incident?

elements.title: Ben Bell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ben Bell was elected at the age of 23 as New Zealand's youngest-ever mayor during the 2022 local elections?

elements.title: Ganggang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ganggang, an Indianapolis-based cultural development firm for Black artists, created a fine art fair called "Butter" that also included a dance party called "Melt"?

elements.title: Tang Zonghai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tang Zonghai was one of the first advocates for the integration of Chinese and Western medicine?

elements.title: Shipyard Railway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that management of the Richmond Shipyards "went out of its way to propagandize against" the Shipyard Railway that was built to serve it?

elements.title: Yusuf al-Hani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yusuf al-Hani was executed by the Ottoman Empire after a letter he wrote to François Georges-Picot was found in the French consulate in Beirut during the First World War?

elements.title: Brain Damage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that real calf brains were used during the production of the 1988 comedy horror film Brain Damage?
